resources.string: This screen displays a list of every alert type the NWS says they can possibly send, as a demo of what that alert will look like when displayed. This is mainly to make it easy to tell which items are still missing appropriate icons or background colors. The NWS Logo on a gray background is the default used if nothing else has been set. Please visit https://github.com/justdave/nwsweatheralertswidget/issues to suggest icons or colors.
There are no alerts at this time for this location
This app provides a home screen widget. To use it, please long-press on your home screen, choose the \"Widgets\" option, and select the NWS Weather Alerts Widget from the list.
Why is there a persistent notification?

Modern Android versions will stop background services that are not actively in use. The persistent notification tells the OS that the app is doing important work and allows it to continue checking for weather alerts in the background so your widgets will stay up to date.

On Android 13 and later, you can minimize the notification by long-pressing on it, tapping the gear icon, tapping the notification category (NWS Weather Alerts Widget), and enabling the \"Minimize\" option.
On Android 12, you can minimize the notification by long-pressing on it, tapping on Settings, tapping on the notification category (NWS Weather Alerts Widget), and enabling the \"Minimize\" option.
On Android 8–11, you can minimize the notification by long-pressing on it, choosing \"All Categories\", tapping on \"NWS Weather Alerts Widget\", selecting \"Importance\", and choosing \"Low\".
